author: Fransinn3

text: Nice selection. Even though a game is bad, it can still have amazing music (a few Sonic games come too mind). I really miss how games had a bouncy, fun attitude about them before all the main characters had too be bald marines with such huge muscles, it'd make Frank Miller blush. I guess Rayman Origins and Ratchet and Clank are still holding on by a thread. I think Spyro really deserves a AAA team behind it again. :(
author: SkepticalFox

text:
Skylanders is a good game but Activision just marketed it as a Spyro game instead of a new franchise to garner in sales and play it safe. The game seems to have no connection to anything Spyro, only in name. 

This is the only reason I have for not actually BUYing it. Although younger gamers with no knowledge of Spyro would get it a majority of the hardcore, or just regular fans, of the series won't pick it up to due bad faith.
author: Oyajitchi

text: I've tried it, Skylanders is good but it has one flaw...if you're gonna go for it, go all it or know what you're doing. Because it will cost you a lot overrall for the whole experience.
author: Arc13

text: I really loved this game. The ability to play as different characters and the "open world" feel of the game makes this one of my favorite Spyro games. I just wished that they brought back the Sorceress instead of Gnasty Gnorc... or at least in addition to. She's my favorite antagonist from the original PS1 trilogy. She was more competent and delightfully evil than Ripto in my opinion.
author: StakeJade

text: I never tried the PS2 Spyro games, I just played and loved the PSX ones. Maybe someday I will try them, even if they are not good...
author: Waka Laka

text:
Hey Supra, thank you for adding a Spyro track! This series has some of the most underrated music out there!

Also have you played the original three? The soundtracks for those are amazing, and fun fact: the composer was the drummer for the band "The Police!". Keep up the good work!

text: I've never actually played the game myself so I can't really judge this, but to me this music doesn't seem to fit the title "Cloudy Domain". It gives me of more of an ethereal atmospheric vibe than the jubilant bliss I feel when thinking of clouds. Still an excellent composition regardless.
